revised_title: A New System for Chemical Equivalents and Proportions
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, presents a new system for determining equivalent weights of chemical compounds, building on Richter's work. This scale allows chemists to easily calculate the composition of neutral salts and reagents, saving time and effort in their analyses. The system is similar to a sliding rule, with numbers representing various chemical elements, acids, and compounds, making it easier to determine equivalent quantities and proportions.
